security_audit.summary: NTM is a legitimate multi-agent orchestration tool for coordinating AI coding assistants. Static findings show mostly false positives from documentation examples. The only confirmed pattern is the pipe-to-shell install method, which is standard practice for CLI tools. Users should review the safety system documentation and avoid using dangerous permission bypass flags in agent configurations.

content.user_title: Orchestrate Multiple AI Agents in Tmux Sessions
content.value_statement: Managing multiple AI coding agents creates window chaos and breaks workflow. NTM solves this by orchestrating Claude, Codex, and Gemini agents in unified tmux sessions with visual dashboards and command palette.
actual_capabilities: Spawn and manage multiple AI agents in tmux panes
Send commands to specific agent types or all agents simultaneously
Visual dashboard with agent status, token metrics, and context indicators
Command palette with fuzzy search for pre-configured prompts
Context window rotation to prevent overflow
Robot mode API for machine-readable output and automation
limitations: Requires tmux 3.0 or higher installed on the system
Agents run with user permissions and full filesystem access
No built-in authentication for multi-user environments
Agent outputs may contain sensitive project information

best_practices: Always review agent outputs before implementing code suggestions
Use context rotation features to prevent token overflow in long sessions
Install the safety system to block dangerous commands like git force push
anti_patterns: Sending sensitive credentials or API keys to AI agents
Allowing unrestricted webhook notifications without reviewing endpoints
Running agents with dangerous permission bypass flags like --dangerously-skip-permissions

faq.question: Is NTM compatible with all tmux versions?
faq.answer: NTM requires tmux 3.0 or higher for full functionality and features

faq.question: What are the system requirements?
faq.answer: Go 1.19 or higher, tmux 3.0+, and a terminal with 256-color support

faq.question: Can I integrate NTM with my existing workflow?
faq.answer: Yes, NTM provides shell integration and command hooks for extensive customization

faq.question: How does NTM handle sensitive data?
faq.answer: NTM has a safety system to block dangerous commands but agents still have full file access

faq.question: What if an agent gets stuck or encounters an error?
faq.answer: Use 'ntm interrupt' to stop all agents or zoom into specific panes to restart them

faq.question: How is NTM different from running agents manually?
faq.answer: NTM provides orchestration, persistence across SSH, and unified management across all agents
